blocks.text: The TR-45L is a 6-band (80m, 40m, 30m, 20m, 17m) CW transceiver with selectable narrow/wideband CW and SSB receive modes, optional Z-Match tuner, LCD display, panel meter, and two-channel keyer memory.
Main power switch (red boot) on lower right. Volume below power switch. Notch filter (200 Hz to 3+ kHz) to left of volume. RF gain to left of notch, then keyer speed control.
Tuning control below display. Short press selects 100 or 10 Hz steps; longer press selects 1 kHz and 1 Hz steps. Underline cursor indicates selected tuning step.
TX power control to right of meter. Switch above selects forward or reverse power display. Red High VSWR indicator above power switch.

blocks.name: Dial Lock/Spot (white boot left of tuning)
blocks.description: Up = Dial Lock (alternating). Down = Battery Check/Spot (momentary). Match received signal to spot tone for exact zero-beat.

blocks.name: Band/VFO (white boot above power)
blocks.description: Short up = advance band (80, 40, 30, 20, 17, repeat). Short down = switch VFO A/B. Long down = store current frequency and mode to EEPROM.

blocks.name: RIT/Mode (white boot above Band/VFO)
blocks.description: Short up = toggle RIT (amber LED when active, tuning shows offset). Short down = toggle narrow/wideband CW. Long down = SSB mode.

blocks.name: Play/Record (below meter)
blocks.description: Left = Record mode (select M1 with dit, M2 with dah). Right = Playback mode (select M1/M2 with paddle). Message plays to end or tap paddle to stop.

blocks.name: Light Level (short handle left of meter)
blocks.description: Controls display backlight and meter illumination. DIM saves ~20 mA battery current.

blocks.name: 700 Hz Filter (upper right short handle)
blocks.description: Toggles narrow 700 Hz audio filter. Only available during narrow band CW operation.

blocks.name: Speaker (lower right short handle)
blocks.description: Controls internal speaker and rear external speaker jack. Does not affect front panel headphone jack.

blocks.text: Two message memories, each storing 25 words (PARIS standard) or 125 characters. Record: flip REC/PLAY left, select M1 (dit) or M2 (dah), key message. Recording ends 3 seconds after you stop sending.
Playback: flip REC/PLAY right, select M1 or M2 with paddle. Message plays immediately. Stop with either paddle tap or REC/PLAY switch. Transmitter is active during playback.
Turn down RF power when checking recorded messages. Don't record on 80m as VFO leakage makes sidetone hard to hear. 80m playback is not affected.
Notch filter adjustable from 200 Hz (fully CCW) to 3+ kHz (fully CW/Out). Set fully CW to bypass the notch. Optional 700 Hz narrow audio filter available in narrow band CW mode only.
Receiver modes: Narrow Band CW, Wide Band CW, SSB. IF bandwidth changes automatically. Display frequency maintains calibration between CW and SSB modes.
Two power inputs: RED jack (5.5x2.1mm) for charger only, BLACK jack (5.5x2.5mm) for external battery. Unit operates from black jack even while charging.
Optional internal 5200 mAh Li-ion battery provides extended operation. Check battery by pressing BATT CHECK/SPOT down - meter should read above S8/S9 level.
Never exceed 14.5V DC. Never connect power other than approved charger to the RED jack. Internal battery does not operate the radio while charger is connected.
Optional Z-Match tuner adds utility for field operation with simple wire antennas. Controls on upper rear panel: two toggle switches and two variable capacitors.
Setup: Connect antenna wire to binding post, counterpoise to other post. Flip tuner to IN. Adjust Tune and Load caps for maximum band noise on receive.

Tune: Turn down RF power to half-scale with key down. Switch meter to reflected power. Adjust Tune and Load for minimum reflected power. Work back and forth - caps are interactive. Use short key-down bursts (5-10 seconds) with rest periods.
Finding a deep null can take practice. The first switch selects 50-ohm BNC or tuner; the second selects balanced or unbalanced output.

blocks.name: Radio won't operate from internal battery while charging
blocks.description: This is normal behavior. Connect external battery to BLACK jack to operate while charging the internal battery.

blocks.name: Can't hear sidetone when recording on 80m
blocks.description: Lower VFO leakage into receiver on 80m makes sidetone hard to hear. Record on another band; 80m playback works normally.

blocks.name: High VSWR indicator stays on
blocks.description: Antenna match needs improvement. Use the Z-Match tuner and adjust for minimum reflected power.

blocks.name: Opposite sideband needed
blocks.description: Hold RIT switch up for a few seconds to toggle sideband. Not recommended for normal use - image rejection suffers and spurs may occur.
